zombie.name: Brianna
zombie.backstory: I lost my soul dog, a golden retriever named Biscuit, to cancer when he was only 8 years old. After he passed, I fell into a rabbit hole researching pet nutrition and was SHOCKED by what I learned. The kibble I'd been feeding him for years was full of fillers, preservatives, and ingredients I couldn't pronounce. I started researching what dogs ACTUALLY need to thrive. The more I learned, the more I realized most pet parents have no idea they're slowly poisoning their fur babies with processed pet food. I became obsessed with species-appropriate nutrition.
zombie.dramaticMoment: The moment that changed everything was when the vet looked at me and said 'there's nothing more we can do' for Biscuit. He was only 8. I held him as he crossed the rainbow bridge and promised him - if I'd known about nutrition sooner, maybe I could have given him more years. That guilt haunted me until I realized I could turn it into purpose. I couldn't save Biscuit, but I could help OTHER pet parents give their babies the nutrition they deserve.
zombie.transformation: From grieving pet mom who felt guilty for years about feeding Biscuit processed food â†’ To certified pet nutrition consultant making $4,200/month helping pet parents feed their fur babies for longevity and vitality.
zombie.incomeStory: $4,200/month working 18 hours/week. Started with a free Facebook group for pet parents in my neighborhood. Now I have 14 regular clients and a waiting list. My fur babies eat better than most humans and I help other pet parents do the same.

writingStyle.capitalization: mostly lowercase, occasional ALL CAPS for emphasis on pet nutrition truths
writingStyle.punctuation: uses lots of exclamation points, ellipses when emotional about pets, em dashes
writingStyle.tone: passionate about fur babies, uses pet parent language, protective mama bear energy, uses 'you guys' and 'honestly'

zombie.videoTestimonialScript: Hi, I'm Brianna. Three years ago I lost my golden retriever Biscuit to cancer at only 8 years old. The vet said there was nothing more they could do. [PAUSE - emotional] I spent months researching and realized the kibble I'd been feeding him was full of garbage. I felt so guilty. But I turned that pain into purpose. Now I help other pet parents understand species-appropriate nutrition so their fur babies can live long, healthy lives. Last month I made over four thousand dollars doing this work. If you love your pets and want to help others... I understand. And this is your sign.
